title: How to Make Witch's Hat Cookies

steps.headline: Remove the cookies from the package.
steps.description: Inspect each cookie for damage. Use only fully rounded, unchipped or broken cookies for the hats. Make sure the cookie has full fudge coverage on the backside, otherwise discard (or just eat).

steps.headline: Unwrap and ready the chocolate kisses.
steps.description: Unwrap the desired number of Hershey Kisses you plan to use; you'll need one for each hat. Like with the cookies, make sure the kisses are fully intact and have a nice point.

steps.headline: Flip one cookie upside down to face the fudge side upward.
steps.description: This will become the witch's hat "brim."

steps.headline: Add a glob of frosting to the bottom of the Hershey's Kiss.
steps.description: The idea is that the frosting becomes the hat band.

steps.headline: Join the frosted kiss to the cookie.
steps.description: Place in the middle, over the cookie hole. Allow some of the frosting to run out from underneath the kiss.

steps.headline: Use a knife to mold and smooth the frosting.
steps.description: You don't want the frosting to look "blobby" but instead clean and smooth.

steps.headline: Allow to set.
steps.description: Then the witch's hat is ready to serve. Continue making as many as needed.

text: Preparing the Cookies and Kisses Remove the cookies from the package. Inspect each cookie for damage. Use only fully rounded, unchipped or broken cookies for the hats. Make sure the cookie has full fudge coverage on the backside, otherwise discard (or just eat). Unwrap and ready the chocolate kisses. Unwrap the desired number of Hershey Kisses you plan to use; you'll need one for each hat. Like with the cookies, make sure the kisses are fully intact and have a nice point. Assembling the Witch's Hats Flip one cookie upside down to face the fudge side upward. This will become the witch's hat "brim." Add a glob of frosting to the bottom of the Hershey's Kiss. The idea is that the frosting becomes the hat band. Join the frosted kiss to the cookie. Place in the middle, over the cookie hole. Allow some of the frosting to run out from underneath the kiss. Use a knife to mold and smooth the frosting. You don't want the frosting to look "blobby" but instead clean and smooth. Allow to set. Then the witch's hat is ready to serve. Continue making as many as needed.
